channel.title: FlowChat Blog
channel.description: Explore the latest news, updates, and insights from the FlowChat team. Learn about the latest features, best practices, and how to get the most out of FlowChat.

item.title: Build an alt text generator with FlowChat and Next.js
item.description: Tired of the tedious task of writing alt text? This article will show you how to build AltTextr, an AI-powered app using FlowChat, Next.js, and OpenAI that you collaborate with to generate high-quality alternative text, helping you create better, more accessible websites.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Build Your Own GPT-5: Smart Model Routing with FlowChat
item.description: Between o3, o1, 4o, GPT-5, Claude-4.1-opus, Gemini, etc. choosing the right model name for our applications can feel like picking a health insurance plan. In this post, we fix this with FlowChat by building a powerful Multi-Agent System (MAS) that implements the LLM-as-judge pattern: one agent decides "think" or "default," an if-else routes the query, and specialized agents do the work.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: How to Build a Deep-Research Multi‑Agent System
item.description: This blog post dives into Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) and explains how to build a basic deep research workflow in FlowChat and explains when to prefer them over single-agent systems. We also explore how FlowChat particularly shines here, enabling rapid iteration and cherry picking the best models per specialized agentic task.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: 100k stars on GitHub ⭐️
item.description:
FlowChat just hit 100k stars on GitHub!
FlowChat began as a small experiment and has grown into something far bigger than we ever imagined — thanks to the thousands who’ve written code, fixed bugs, shared feedback, and trusted it for their projects.
Hitting 100k stars is a proud milestone, but our mission to democratize AI goes on — and we still treat every day like it’s day one.
Thank you for being part of this journey.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Rodrigo Nader,Unknown)

item.title: The Troubleshooter: Using Render's MCP service to Make Life Easier
item.description: I recently came across Render's new MCP service, and as an avid user of Render to deploy various Python and Javascript based applications, it seemed like a good time to check out how I could use it in my day to day operations. This blog post dives into my experience using this new service with Cursor, Warp, and FlowChat and how I was able to use to improve my service with agents.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: How to run OpenAI’s gpt-oss and GPT-5 models on FlowChat
item.description: Learn how to enable access to the newest OpenAI models, GPT-5 and the open-source gpt-oss-20b and gpt-oss-120b, within FlowChat. From running locally, to cloud services, and employing the models as agents, check out how to start using the latest models in FlowChat.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Query, Split, Search, Synthesize: Automating Deep Research with JigsawStack and FlowChat
item.description: While platforms like Perplexity and OpenAI offer deep research through closed systems, developers can now build their own transparent, extensible research agents using JigsawStack's open-source framework within FlowChat. This hands-on guide shows how to create a multi-step research pipeline that breaks down complex queries, performs iterative web searches, and compiles evidence-backed reports—all through visual workflows that accelerate development without writing code. Learn to prototype AI research agents that you can see, modify, and scale for your specific needs.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Harsha Vardhan Khurdula,Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: FlowChat 1.5: Docling, Windows Support and Improved UX
item.description: FlowChat 1.5 brings a simplified, stable foundation for building AI workflows. With clean core components, improved execution, and a smoother UI, FlowChat keeps evolving for real-world use. FlowChat Desktop is now available for Windows, and the new Docling Bundle takes document processing to a new level.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Rodrigo Nader,Unknown)

item.title: How to Create Secure AI Applications
item.description:
💡This post also exists as a video for those who prefer watching over reading.
You’ve built an impressive AI agent. It can query databases, call external APIs, and even
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: LLM Observability Explained (feat. Langfuse, LangSmith, and LangWatch)
item.description: Building a new application powered by Large Language Models (LLMs) is an exciting venture. With frameworks and APIs at our fingertips, creating a proof-of-concept can tak
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: From 'no-reply' to 'please-reply': How to build an AI-Powered Email Assistant with FlowChat and SendGrid
item.description: This post will walk you through how you can build your own "please-reply" system using FlowChat, the easiest way to build AI agents, and SendGrid's Inbound Parse. We'll show you how you can build one for your own organization.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: Build AI powered phone calls with Twilio ConversationRelay and FlowChat
item.description: Connect your FlowChat flows to phone calls using Twilio ConversationRelay and build AI-powered voice assistants. Learn to handle speech-to-text and text-to-speech, and how to stream responses for a more natural conversation.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Generate Personalized Action Figures and Mythical Creatures using next.js and AI with FlowChat
item.description: Hello, fellow dev nerds! 👋 Inspired by some intriguing displays at GitHub Universe, we embarked on a mission to create an app that generates unique, visually stunning "C
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: Building an AI-powered Fashion Recommendation App
item.description: In this guide, Melissa Herrera walks through the development process of creating an AI fashion recommendation app that takes user-provided images and/or text queries to deliver tailored clothing recommendations.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: How to Host Your AI Agents and MCP Servers on FlowChat Anywhere
item.description: This guide will walk you through deploying FlowChat to a variety of popular hosting platforms - FlightControl, Fly.io, Render, and Hetzner - transforming your local projects into globally accessible AI powerhouses.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: FlowChat 1.4: Organize Workflows + Connect with MCP
item.description:

FlowChat 1.4 introduces Projects to organize and scale workflows and makes it simple to expose them over MCP. With FlowChat Desktop, your machine becomes a local A
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Scott Regan,Unknown)

item.title: 🌐 Web Search in Your AI Agents: A FlowChat Tutorial
item.description: LLM models face a significant limitation: they're often restricted to information available in their training data. But what if your AI agent could retrieve up-to-date information from the web in real time? Let's walk you through how to implement web search capabilities in your FlowChat flows.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: Introduction to Webhooks in FlowChat (Step-by-Step Guide)
item.description: Hey there, developers! 👋 Melissa here, and today I'm diving into the world of webhooks in FlowChat. Whether you're a seasoned coder or just getting started, this guide w
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: FlowChat Launch Week Wrap Up
item.description: Wrapping-up a big week of FlowChat launches, including: MCP, file system & data pipelines, Voice Mode, Desktop and GraphRAG.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Carter Rabasa,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 5 - Graph RAG 🕸️
item.description: The new Graph RAG component in FlowChat takes your workflows to the next level by improving accuracy and incorporating data relationships directly.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 4 - FlowChat Desktop 👨🏽‍💻
item.description: We’re excited to launch FlowChat Desktop, a new version of FlowChat that developers can run natively on their development machines.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Rodrigo Nader,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 3 - Voice Mode 🎙️
item.description: Today, we’re thrilled to introduce a cool new feature in FlowChat: Voice Mode! 🎤 This new addition allows you to engage in natural, voice-based conversations with any of your FlowChat flows.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 2 - Files & Data 💾
item.description: Big updates to FlowChat, including: 📤 Multi-file Uploads, 🗃️ New File Management System, 🔄 Cross-Flow File Access, 📊 Enhanced CSV Handling.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 1 - MCP ⚡️
item.description: FlowChat can now be used as both an MCP client and MCP server. As a client, you can use a built-in MCP component to interact with external MCP servers within your agentic flows. As a server, you can turn your existing FlowChat workflows into tools that other MCP clients can access and orchestrate.
item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: Announcing FlowChat Launch Week
item.description:

item.author: please-reply@flowchat.org (Scott Regan,Unknown)
